content:
You might be seeing the kind of issue that happens when the sending app is 32-bit but TB is 64-bit:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1520249#answer-1746126
creator: sfhowes

content:
• Start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
  • Still In Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Does problem change? (many users have found antivirus software causing problems)
creator: wsmwk

content: There is no upper limit, although managing such large files puts a strain on the PC resources. I suggest checking within profile to see if there are entries that can be removed, such as any 'nstmp files'. I suggest NOT zipping the backups unless you do this when Thunderbird is not running. I state that because attempts to import/restore zipped files is a road of failures. If the account is Gmail, I suggest NOT subscribing to AllMail or Import folders, as those are duplicates of other folders and increase disk space and computer resources to send and receive mail. If you want to reduce backup storage space, just exit thunderbird, delete the message folders prior to the backup. On a restore, THunderbird automatically reconstructs them. My personal approach is periodically purging unneeded messages. That does a lot to keep the folders smaller. Good luck.
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: As you state, Thunderbird does NOT have a whitelisting process. The addressbook only ensures that the messages are not immediately marked as spam. You might check your account online to see if the messages are being flagged prior to being read by Thunderbird. The junk filter needs to be actively monitored and taught, not just for spam, but also for good messages. More info at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: davidsk

content: David, many thanks for your very rapid response, which is appreciated. Unfortunately, it does little to reconcile me to Thunderbird. "Unmarking" junk messages would work for me, if I hadn't noticed that actually, it doesn't learn; messages specifically designated as not junk do indeed get moved to the incoming folder, but often the application will happily ignore the directive when another email arrives from the same source at a later date. As I have a number of email accounts which I like being able to consult on one single application, this strongly suggests that I am expected to play games of whack-a-mole far into the future. I guess it's time to dig out Microsoft Outlook again. I liked Thunderbird, but an inability to learn something as basic as what not to treat as spam is a deal-breaker...
creator: Akominatus

content: Sorry to see you go.
creator: davidsk

content:
If mail is ending up in a Spam folder, it's due to the mail provider's filters, and is independent of TB. Whitelist or unblock senders through webmail.

content: Voor problemen met verzenden kunt u dit artikel raadplegen: https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/kan-geen-berichten-verzenden. De toepasselijke gegevens van Telenet kunt u hier terug vinden: https://www2.telenet.be/residential/nl/klantenservice/internet/e-mail/e-mail-instellen.html.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: Probleem niet opgelost. Uitgaande telenet-server is nu SMTP, zoals in de info beschreven. Emails vanuit mijn email-adres lukt wel, emails verzenden met (telenet)-adres van mijn vrouw lukt niet. Email-adres van mijn vrouw is identiteit onder mijn email-account.
creator: ldbroosdaal

content: Het kan zijn dat u voor het verzenden, uw eigen gebruikersnaam/e-mailadres en wachtwoord moet gebruiken en niet die van uw vrouw.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: Dat is geen oplossing. Mijn vrouw wil haar eigen email-adres gebruiken. Waarom kon dit in het verleden wel, en nu plots niet meer? De fout ligt bij thunderbird, niet bij telenet.
creator: ldbroosdaal

content: Als u een identiteit met een ander adres gebruikt, dan dient u waarschijnlijk de aanmeldgegevens van uw eigen adres in te geven bij de servergegevens in de accountinstellingen; mogelijk herkent de server het adres van uw vrouw alleen als doorstuuradres en niet als aanmeldgegevens.
creator: markh2

content: Nog niet opgelost. We krijgen steeds de melding Use authenticated SMTP. Bij de accountinstellingen wijzigen we dan de uitgaande server van Telenet in de SMTP-server van Telenet, zoals vermeld in de info van telenet. De eerste mail die we dan sturen lukt mits ingeven wachtwoord. Na 5 minuten willen we het nog eens doen, maar dan lukt het niet meer. Als we dan naar de accountinstellingen gaan kijken is opnieuw de oude uitgaande server van telenet aangeduid en is de SMTP-server verdwenen.
creator: ldbroosdaal

content: Als u de oude SMTP-server niet meer nodig hebt, kunt u die verwijderen. Bij accountinstellingen kunt u ook aangeven welke SMTP-server gebruikt moet worden. Selecteer daarvoor onder Accountinstellingen de betreffende account en selecteer onderaan bij ‘Uitgaande server’. Ook bij Accountinstellingen kunt u in de linker kolom onderaan ‘Uitgaande server’ selecteren voor een overzicht van de SMTP-servers.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: We hebben alles al geprobeerd. Contact met Telenet bracht ook geen oplossing. Met mijn emailadres loopt alles perfect. Waarom lukt dat niet met het mailadres van mijn vrouw die dezelfde uitgaande server heeft aangeduid? Het is eigenaardig dat dit zo plots veranderd is. Is er een update van thunderbird geweest?
creator: ldbroosdaal

content:
Er zijn de afgelopen tijd inderdaad updates geweest van Thunderbird, net zoals van Windows, uw virusscanner, en mogelijk bij Telenet, maar aangezien het bij uzelf wel functioneert lijkt dat niet het probleem. Het e-mailadres van uw vrouw is niet hetzelfde als die van u, dus er zitten ook verschillen in de configuratie.

  • Hebt u inmiddels slechts 1 uitgaande SMTP-server?
  • Staat deze SMTP-server ook als standaard geconfigureerd bij de accountinstellingen van de e-mailaccount?
  • Hebt u bij het eerste maal succesvol verzenden er voor gekozen om het wachtwoord op te slaan?
  • Hebt u de configuratie van de SMTP-server gecontroleerd?
  • Maakt u bijvoorbeeld gebruik van ‘Normaal wachtwoord’ of een andere optie?
  • Zijn de gegevens op uw pc/laptop exact gelijk aan die van uw vrouw?
  • Kunt u met de gebruikersnaam en wachtwoord van uw vrouw haar e-mailadres aanmelden via webmail?
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Since they let me back in this place, I will copy over the solution from that bugzilla thread that worked for me:

You have to set an account as the "default" account.

Go to Account Settings Pick which one should be your main account On the top of it's page choose: Set as Default

Now my +New Message button works again!

Thanks everyone!

content:
Hello

Yes , it can be there that after certain Thunderbird software version update s that had settings that belong in the kalander section are gone. The reason that these old kalander settings did not make it to update them along from the old version to the another newer version the latest version of Thunderbird, is that it might be there that add ons that where there probably has being outdated there or files where corrupted at times in the previous version s of Thunderbird or some old conflicting extension s where there present to somehow to interrupt that update process. It ain’t a misspell or a sort of error . It just where there without knowing the fact of being there. You toke the update and there you are. A new version of Thunderbird without the old setting or reminders from that kalender. There might be a complete list from these unknown missettings when the update arrives. It ain’t harmful for the update but in some cases they are missing , yes correct.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

Look in the thunderbird settings and go to the kalander settings and click kalender, look for enabling missed reminders and enable them there if possible then look for that option to have in text show missed reminders, it also could labeled as for show missed reminders for writable kalanders Try to enable that function to use it again it is right ,that it might went turned off by the last update of this year that is used. Now

Greetings googlethunderbird.

We don't do that. One reason is because some users run old versions of Thunderbird.

Install https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/addon-compatibility-check/ which will show suggestions for known alternative add-ons if the add-on you have installed is not compatible. If none are shown then it is unlikely an alternative exists.

content:
In this regard, I'd like to offer a piece of advice: when you recommend exporting the entire profile folder, unfortunately it brings with it. Unfortunately, this will take with it all the corrupted files, old installations, and old add-ons. If possible, it would be helpful to have only the layout, settings, and account files in the Profile folder.

I noticed that my Profile folder is 214 megabytes, the new one I was creating was a few MB
creator: furio.sassi

content:
Phoenity icons is labeled as based on experiments at https://thunderbird.github.io/webext-reports/atn-tb128.html. So even if it is marked as version "compatible" or installs, it is possible for it to have or cause problems.

Furio Sassi said

content:
IMAP has the ability to access mail from more than one device and is generally safer from losing messages. POP messages that have been downloaded remain unchanged with no loss. When changing to IMAP, do NOT attempt to change the POP account to IMAP. Dragons be there. Instead, create an IMAP account alongside the POP account. Then, use the addon, importexporttools NG and follow these steps:

  1. highlight Local Folder
  2. rightclick and select importexport option to import mbox
  3. click to the profile's Mail\<POPaccount> folder and select the inbox (not imbox.msf) and that will copy the folder to Local Folder.
  4. repeat for the Sent folder

With the messages now saved, you can delete the POP account.
creator: davidsk

content:
Francesca Mangiaracina said
You are referreing to Thunderbird? It is strange as some sent emails are saved in the sent folder others not. For the ones are not saved I do not receive the Delivery status notification (failed).

If you apply the recommended settings, messages sent from TB will appear in Sent Mail. Those same messages will appear in the Sent folder that is shown in the gmail webmail interface (which doesn't display a Sent Mail folder). If you send a message from e.g. the gmail Android app or gmail webmail, the sent message appears in the webmail and app Sent folder, and also in the TB Sent Mail.

Confusing? Yes, but it's consistent once you understand the process.
creator: sfhowes

content: I solved my problem. I used grep, head, and tail to find the offending message in my large Inbox file, and I could not find it. Then I realized that the Inbox.msf must be corrupted. I exited TB, rename the Inbox.msf file, and restarted TB. The offending message no longer appeared in the Inbox summary pane. (Before I retired I once helped a user recover a handful of mail messages from a 3-GB mbox file.)

content: So what do you do if your target folder is a subfolder and the parent won't open? Just drop it on the parent folder without knowing where it will land?
creator: Mapenzi

content: No. Obviously I have the target folder or subfolder in sight when I drag another folder into it. However, your question does raise an important scenario: If I wanted to drag a folder into a folder that is buried deep in a list of subfolders of a parent folder that is closed, then the ideal behavior would be that if I hover over the closed folder (not less than 2 seconds) it should then open, and so on down the line. But if you simply drag & drop a folder into a closed one then that's where it should go, and stay closed. But having it open instantly without the 2-second hover period is catastrophic. Here's why this is so important for me: I have a top level folder called ORDERS. Under it I have: Orders A-C Orders D-F Orders H-J Orders K-M etc, etc. And under each of these is another group of folders by customer names (some 70 to 80 under each letter group).This tree exists because without it I would have to scroll endlessly to arrive at the desired target subfolder to drop a particular message (or order folder) into. And it is a Huge pain when the long subfolder tree instantly opens upon drag release, forcing me to endlessly scroll again, or jump to the top to close the trees again to drag the next folder to its destination. This never used to happen in the past. Of course I also use Axel Grude's QuickFolders app, which is a godsend.

content:
Try this.

Open the profile folder:

- TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- under the Application Basics section next to Profile Folder, click 'Open Folder'

- close TB

- press ctrl-shift-esc (Win) to open the Task Manager

- if there are any TB processes running, R. click > end them

- delete the parent.lock file in the profile folder

- restart TB

- see if the saved file opens

content: The New Account Hub is botched in 140. For one thing, the 'authentication' is labelled SSL/TLS, when that is the connection security. The authentication is OAuth2. You can either disable the New Account Hub in Settings, or add the account in Offline mode (click the icon at the left end of the status bar) and enter the settings manually (Advanced config.). Once the account is added, go back online, select the Inbox, and enter the account password in the OAuth window.

content:
• In genere non è necessario che la versione di origine e quella di destinazione siano uguali. Tra la 115 e la 140 non dovrebbero esserci problemi, tant'è che le mail inizialmente vengono mostrate.
  • secondo me il problema risiede nel protocollo usato. Probabilmente i tuoi account sono configurati con IMAP: questo protocollo prevede la costante sincronizzazione con il server. Se le email non sono più presenti sul server, per tener fede al protocollo IMAP, Thunderbird le cancella anche localmente.

Se l'ipotesi è fondata potresti risolvere in questo modo: - Copia nuovamente il vecchio profilo sopra il nuovo - Chiudi/spegni/stacca la connessione del computer ad Internet - Avvia Thunderbird - Se la posta è presenta, copiala o spostala in una o più sottocartelle sotto Cartelle Locali. - A questo punto dovresti poter ricollegare la rete

content: The actual name of the addressbook is abook.sqlite. Click tools>import>import a file, then follow the links for addressbook and then the option for sqlite file and then select and click the abook.sqlite file from within old profile. Repeat the process for the collected address addressbook, which is named history.sqlite. (Or, you can exit thunderbird and simply use windows file explorer to copy and paste the files.)

content:
Here is a possible solution taken from a previous answer. In Thunderbird 

   Menu icon > Addons and Themes    Select 'Themes'.

Are you using a default Thunderbird 'Light' theme ?

Are you using the 'System theme -auto' ? If yes, then Enable the 'Light' theme.

Have you tried using the 'Dark' theme? 

   Menu icon > Settings > General    Under 'Language & Appearance'    Fonts & Colours' - click on 'Colours' button    Set 'Text' to 'Black'    Set 'Background' to 'white'    Do NOT select 'Use System colours'    Override the colours specified....... set to 'Only with High Contrast themes' or 'Never'    Click on 'OK'
